ISSUE.TITLE: Configuring Heroku 1-click install, improve documentation "Cannot GET /" error
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: I'm trying to get started with this using Heroku. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3807458/120083896-447f8000-c0cc-11eb-9966-b9b4f940c6df.png) It created a domain at https://test-nocodb-world.herokuapp.com/ but doesn't show anything besides `Cannot GET /`. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3807458/120083944-94f6dd80-c0cc-11eb-83ca-29e0d09464e3.png) I'm not familiar with Heroku and didn't immediately understood what I had to do. It seems I haven't specified the requested [environment variables](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb#environment-variables), especially `DATABASE_URL`. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3807458/120083975-ca9bc680-c0cc-11eb-8e75-c55a8c4b4aa5.png) I think it'd be better to: - Specify all requested environment variables when configuring Heroku (e.g: add `DATABASE_URL=TO DO`) to make it obvious it should be set - Specify in the https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb#1-click-deploy section to check https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb#environment-variables to configure Heroku (I didn't notice it at first)
